full_summary:
**Standing Offer Invitation - Rideau Canal National Historic Site**
Rideau Canal National Historic Site
**Tender Notice Reference Number:** CB-7566-14305556
**Published on:** July 25, 2023
**Closing Date for Receipt of Standing Offers:** August 21, 2023 at 2:00 PM
**Amendment Number:** 3

**Background and Requirements:**
Parks Canada Agency is seeking Standing Offers from qualified suppliers for the provision of crane rental services with operators. This amendment extends the closing date to receive Standing Offers for the provision of these services.

**Description of Services:**
Parks Canada Agency requires the provision of all necessary labour, materials, tools, equipment, transportation, and supervision to rent cranes of various configurations with operators to the Rideau Canal National Historic Site. The work area covers the locks on the Rideau Canal System from the Kingston Mills Lock in Kingston to the Ottawa Locks on the Ottawa River.

**Period of the Standing Offer:**
The Standing Offers will be awarded for a period of [insert time]. Standing Offers may be made for up to three (3) crane sizes: 50, 80, 110, 150, 200, and 300 tonnes.

**Bidding and Submission Instructions:**
Bidders are required to submit their Standing Offers electronically through the Government of Canada's electronic tendering service at http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities. Addenda will be available on the same website. 

The only acceptable email address for responses to the bid solicitation is soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca. Emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted. Bid documents must be sent as email attachments. The maximum email file size that Parks Canada can receive is 15 megabytes. 

Please note that Parks Canada does not currently accept Standing Offer submissions through SAP Ariba. Bidders must submit their Standing Offers via email or fax as indicated in the solicitation document.

**Deadlines and Requirements:**
Bids received after the closing date and time will not be considered. Bidders must account for delays in transmission and ensure their attachments and documents are sent as requested. All inquiries must be submitted in writing to the Contracting Authority at least seven (7) calendar days prior to the closing date.

**Key Information and Contacts:**
National Parks Regulations require that all work be performed in accordance with the ordinances, laws, rules, and regulations set out in the National Park Act
